down the other side of the chain 2 slip_stitch 3 single_crochet 3 half_double_crochet 6 double_crochet chain 3 slip_stitch into same stitch 4 slip_stitch chain 2 working into the same st as previous slip_stitch 3hdc 3sc 2sl st* chain 1 and turn 25 row 3 repeat row 1 row 4 repeat row 2 center switch to 4mm crochet hook spine slip_stitch to other end fasten_off to desired length construction 4mm crochet hook optional tail can be woven in by using a darning needle and pulling it straight through the underside of the center spine line up all your petals using a stitch markers mark the 10th stitch from the tip of each petal with the right side facing outward slip_stitch petals together i personally used color coded stitch markers and worked my way diagonally across when attaching metals using a total of 3 strands to minimize weaving in ends be careful you don t st the wrong petals together you will need a separate strand of yarn to attach the parts of the petal distal to the ear holes don t weave in the last tail to use to attach the chin strap leaves 5mm crochet hook mc 6 single_crochet 6 working in the round single_crochet increase 1 in each st slip_stitch 12 treble_crochet increase 1 in each st slip_stitch slip_stitch ch1 fasten_off 24 you will now to working in the crocodile stitch i recommend watching a youtube tutorial if you are unfamiliar with this construction there is a total of 6 leaves each half is worked around 1 treble_crochet you made previously for every pair of treble_crochet required to make 1 leaf skip the next pair of treble_crochet working around the first treble_crochet away from the center of the mc slip_stitch 7 double_crochet chain 3 and slip_stitch into the base of the precious double_crochet this creates the pointy tip and turn working around the next treble_crochet towards the center of the mc 7 double_crochet slip_stitch between the next pair of treble_crochet to anchor the leave down repeat i used white yarn to attach the tip of each leaf to the seams between each petal beware it s a lot of ends to weave in so i understand if you rathe glue it the stem should be enough to hold it in place stem 5 mm crochet hook fhdc 24 chain 1 and fold over slip_stitch halves together around the edges the starting and ending tails should be on the same side pull stem through the center of the mc and top of the flower tie in
